Key Arguments: The proposed legislation infringes on human rights, particularly freedom of speech as protected under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR).
The government lacks the mandate to implement such policies, given its slim majority.
The legislation is seen as an overreach of government power, similar to past actions during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The government should focus on transparency and accountability, requiring public figures to disclose conflicts of interest.
The legislation is perceived as a means to control and restrict public discourse, rather than fostering open debate.
Notable Quotes: To have a body define what information ‘is’ by labelling what it ‘isn’t’ is false logic.
A thriving democracy is built around debate, not restricting it by socially shaming and labelling people as this bill proposes to do.
Australians have a clear sense of what is BS and what isn’t.
